items.title: Green Dayâ€™s Billie Joe Armstrong Encourages ICE Agents to â€˜Quit That Sâ€”ty Jobâ€™ at Super BowlÂ Pre-Show
items.summary: The Bay Area trio took the stage at Pier 29 ahead of the big game.
items.body: Green Day â€™s Billie Joe Armstrong delivered a pointed political message during the bandâ€™s preâ€‘Super Bowl concert in San Francisco. During the punk-rock trioâ€™s Friday (Feb. 6) performance at The FanDuel Party Powered by Spotify 2026 at Pier 29, Armstrong urged ICE agents to consider a different career path ahead of Sundayâ€™s (Feb. 8) big game between the Seattle Seahawks and the New England Patriots. Related Donald Trump Berates Bad Bunny, Green Day Ahead of Super Bowl Performances: ‘I’m Anti-Them’ Bad Bunny Is Playing the Super Bowl Halftime Show: Can We All Just Shut Up and Dance? Green Day’s Billie Joe Armstrong Pledges Support For ‘Brothers and Sisters in Minnesota’ Amid Ongoing ICE Immigration Raids â€œQuit your sâ€”ty ass job. Quit that shitty job you have,â€ the frontman told the crowd . â€œBecause when this is over, and it will be over at some point of time, Kristi Noem, Stephen Miller, JD Vance, Donald Trump â€” theyâ€™re gonna drop you like a bad fâ€”king habit. Come on to this side of the line.â€ Armstrongâ€™s remarks appeared aimed at ICE agents who might be in the Bay Area for Super Bowl LX, where Bad Bunny will perform during halftime at Lâ€¦

items.title: Nurmagomedov submits Briton Davis with unorthodox choke
items.summary: Usman Nurmagomedov outclasses Alfie Davis before submitting the Briton in the third round to retain his PFL lightweight title in Dubai.

items.title: Inside the 2026 Super Bowl Parties: J Balvin, Diplo, Green Day &Â More
items.summary: From Becky G to Travis Scott, see all the music stars that joined 2026's Super Bowl parties in San Francisco.
items.body: The Bay Area filled up with celebrities from every industry for the 2026 Super Bowl, set to take place at Leviâ€™s Stadium on Sunday (Feb. 8) â€” and music stars were not the exception. As spectators gear up for the New England Patriots and Seattle Seahawks game that includes a historic headlining Super Bowl halftime show by Bad Bunny , many parties took place across San Francisco leading up to the big event. Billboard was present at many invite-only events, including the FanDuel Party Powered by Spotify that featured two rocking performances by Counting Crows and Green Day . The latter â€” formed by Billie Joe Armstrong, Mike Dirnt and TrÃ© Cool â€” is set to kick off this yearâ€™s Super Bowl opening ceremony with â€œtheir most iconic rock anthems,â€ the NFL previously announced . genr Meanwhile, Apple Music, which is presenting the halftime show this year, kicked off the weekend with a celebration at Apple Union Square that included special guests such as J Balvin , Becky G , Diplo , Travis Scott and Luis Fonsi , as well as a set by Bad Bunnyâ€™s official touring deejay, DJ Orma. â€œI just want people to have fun,â€ Bad Bunny said during a press conference ahead of his big show on Sunday. “Iâ€¦

items.title: England's riot club focus on fine-tuning after walloping Wales
items.summary: Steve Borthwick has the pleasure of nit-picking through fine details after his England side swat aside Wales in their Six Nations opener.

items.title: Brad Arnold, 3 Doors Down Lead Singer, Dies at 47 After CancerÂ Battle
items.summary: The musician revealed his stage 4 kidney cancer diagnosis in May 2025.
items.body: Brad Arnold , a founding member and lead singer of 3 Doors Down , has died following a battle with cancer. He was 47. The musician passed away peacefully in his sleep on Saturday (Feb. 7), surrounded by his wife, Jennifer, and loved ones, the Mississippi-based rock band wrote on its official Instagram page. Related Gone But Not Forgotten: Musicians We Lost in 2026 3 Doors Down Singer Brad Arnold Reveals Stage 4 Kidney Cancer Diagnosis: ‘I Have No Fear’ Ludwig GÃ¶ransson, 'Golden' & More Win at 2026 Society of Composers & Lyricists Awards: Full List “As a founding member, vocalist, and original drummer of 3 Doors Down, Brad helped redefine mainstream rock, blending post-grunge accessibility with emotionally direct songwriting and lyrical themes that resonated with everyday listeners,” the band wrote in a statement. 3 Doors Down announced in May 2025 that Arnold had been diagnosed with stage 4 kidney cancer and that the band would cancel its summer tour. In a video posted to social media at the time, Arnold shared the news himself, noting that he was battling clear cell renal cell carcinoma, which had spread to his lungs. â€œI have noâ€¦

items.title: Is 'unstoppable' Palmer in the World Cup picture?
items.summary: By scoring a first-half hat-trick against Wolves on Saturday, Cole Palmer provided a timely reminder of his talent, putting himself firmly in the England conversation.

items.title: Outtara scores late to give Brentford win over Newcastle
items.summary: Dango Outtara scores in the 85th minute to give Brentford a 3-2 win over Newcastle United, as the visitors win their first game at St James' Park since 1934.

items.title: Everton produce second-half comeback to beat Fulham
items.summary: Everton score twice in the final fifteen minutes to secure a 2-1 away win over Fulham at Craven Cottage in the Premier League.

items.title: Teenager Rayan scores as Bournemouth draw against Villa
items.summary: Bournemouth come from behind to earn a 1-1 draw with Aston Villa, thanks to a goal from Brazilian teenager Rayan on his first start for the club.

items.title: Gyokeres scores twice as Arsenal beat Sunderland
items.summary: Viktor Gyokeres scores two goals as Arsenal comfortably beat Sunderland 3-0 to extend their lead at the top of the Premier League table to nine points.

items.title: Romero red helps Man Utd continue perfect start under Carrick
items.summary: Goals from Bryan Mbeumo and Bruno Fernandes help Manchester United to a 2-0 win over 10-man Tottenham, who saw captain Cristian Romero sent off for the second time this season in the Premier League.

items.title: West Ham beat Burnley to boost survival hopes
items.summary: Goals from Crysencio Summerville and Taty Castellanos give West Ham a crucial 2-0 win against Burnley, to move them within three points of 17th-placed Nottingham Forest in the Premier League.

items.title: Palmer scores first-half hat-trick as Chelsea beat Wolves
items.summary: Cole Palmer becomes the first player in Premier League history to score three career first-half hat-tricks, as Chelsea see off Wolves 3-1 at Molineux.

items.title: England intensity was superb from the start - Borthwick
items.summary: England head coach Steve Borthwick was delighted with his side's intensity from the beginning of the match and their defensive quality, during the 48-7 win over Wales in their first match of the Six Nations.

items.title: Lana Del Rey Teases Release Date for New Single, Credits Husband Jeremy Dufrene as aÂ Co-Writer
items.summary: The singerâ€™s long-delayed country project Stove was originally expected in January.
items.body: Lana Del Rey is giving fans an update on music from her long-delayed country album. On Saturday (Feb. 7), the 40-year-old singer-songwriter took to social media to tease the title and release date of her â€œfavoriteâ€ track from the upcoming project, Stove . Related Lana Del Rey Announces New Album â€˜Lassoâ€™ Ludwig GÃ¶ransson, 'Golden' & More Win at 2026 Society of Composers & Lyricists Awards: Full List Bad Bunny Ahead of Super Bowl: 'I'm Just a Normal Guy That Makes Music' â€œI just wanted to make a little message and let you know that my new single, my favorite song [from the new album] â€” this is the one Iâ€™ve been waiting for,â€ Del Rey said in a video shared to her Instagram Story . â€œ’White Feather Hawk Tail Deer Hunter’ is coming out on the 17th,â€ she added, without specifying the month, though itâ€™s presumably February. The songstress noted that she worked on the track with producers Drew Erickson and Jack Antonoff, who “finally found that magical chord that I was missing.” The song was co-written with her husband, Jeremy Dufrene, her brother-in-law, and her sister Caroline â€œChuckâ€ Grant, with mixing handled by Dean Reid anâ€¦

items.title: Team GB skeleton helmet appeal dismissed by Cas
items.summary: The British skeleton team - among Team GB's best hopes for medals at the Winter Olympics - will not be able to wear their new helmets after the Court of Arbitration for Sport said they do not comply with the sport's rules around shape.

items.title: 'Townsend on the ropes after romp in swamp'
items.summary: Arguments for Gregor Townsend remaining as Scotland head coach are growing increasingly small after familiar failings lead to defeat in rainy Rome, writes Tom English.

items.title: Arundell scores hat-trick as England heap misery on Wales
items.summary: A remorseless England pile misery and points on Wales as they began their hunt for a first Six Nations title since 2020.

items.title: Arundell scores hat-trick as England heap misery on Wales
items.summary: A remorseless England pile misery and points on Wales as they began their hunt for a first Six Nations title since 2020.

items.title: Boulter seals fourth WTA title with Ostrava Open win
items.summary: Britain's Katie Boulter claims her fourth WTA Tour title with a three-set victory against Tamara Korpatsch at the Ostrava Open on Saturday.

items.title: Bad Bunny Is Playing the Super Bowl Halftime Show: Can We All Just Shut Up andÂ Dance?
items.summary: Thousands of opinions are flying around. But in the end, this is really about music.
items.body: Iâ€™m going to wager that no other Super Bowl Halftime Show artist in history has garnered as much chatter, opinion, controversy or opinion pieces as Bad Bunny , who will perform on Sunday (Feb. 8) at the final between the Seattle Seahawks and the New England Patriots in Santa Clara, California. Related Let’s Stop Pretending Politics Is the Reason People Are Angry About Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl Halftime Set Bad Bunnyâ€™s Super Bowl LX Halftime Show: Our Dream Setlist How to Watch Super Bowl LX & Bad Bunny’s Halftime Show Online for Free Every media outlet in the country seems to have a point of view: Is his performance a political statement? A cultural statement? An act of defiance? An act of disrespect toward this most venerable American sports tradition? A Latino power move? A Puerto Rican power move? In the past few weeks, Iâ€™ve received dozens of emails offering the opinion of industry leaders, hospitality executives, CEOs, entertainment figures, data companies and, in a twist, countless Latino and Puerto Rican university professors and PhDs touted as sage talking heads. The opinions on Bad Bunny tend to fly fast and furious or high and lofty. In â€¦

items.title: I believe in what we're doing, says defiant Townsend
items.summary: Head coach Gregor Townsend insists he is still the man to lead Scotland despite a hugely dispiriting defeat by Italy in their Six Nations opener.

items.title: West Ham have to keep believing - Bowen
items.summary: West Ham captain Jarrod Bowen tells Final Score that West Ham have to "keep believing, keep fighting" as they try to escape the Premier League relegation zone.

items.title: Will Vonn do the unthinkable and win Olympic gold?
items.summary: Veteran skier Lindsey Vonn is a "iconic superhuman athlete" and is "risking everything" by racing with an anterior cruciate ligament injury on Sunday, says former Olympic skier Chemmy Alcott.

items.title: Suryakumar rescues India from all-time shock by USA
items.summary: Suryakumar Yadav rescues India from an almighty scare as T20 World Cup co-hosts beat the United States by 29 runs in Mumbai.

items.title: Speed skater's son joins celebrations for Italy's first gold
items.summary: Francesca Lollobrigida celebrates with her young son after winning Italy's first gold medal at this year's Winter Olympics in the women's 3,000m speed skating.

items.title: Holders Swifts, Reds, Coleraine & Larne progress in Irish Cup
items.summary: Holders Dungannon Swifts beat Portadown 2-1 to reach the Irish Cup quarter-finals, while Cliftonville earn a dramatic late win over Glenavon by the same scoreline and Coleraine are extra-time winners over Carrick Rangers.

items.title: Conditions don't excuse Scotland errors - analysis
items.summary: Six Nations pundits John Barclay and Martin Johnson do not believe torrential rain is a valid excuse for the errors Scotland made in their defeat against Italy, as both sides were playing under the same conditions.

items.title: Hereâ€™s What Happened at the Opening Ceremony of the Winter OlympicsÂ 2026
items.summary: The Games officially started in Milan on Feb. 6, with performances by Mariah Carey, Laura Pausini and Andrea Bocelli.
items.body: The Winter Olympics of Milano Cortina 2026 are the major event that perpetuates Milan’s renewed international momentum, which began more than a decade ago with Expo 2015. They are also a strategic opportunity for Italy in a geopolitical context where international relations are rapidly changing and are also at stake in symbolic events such as sporting ones, as well as in the host countryâ€™s ability to manage them at best. Related Mariah Carey Nails Italian Rendition of ‘Volare’ & ‘Nothing Is Impossible’ at Olympics Opening Ceremony How to Watch the 2026 Winter Olympics Online for Free and Without Cable Laura Pausini Sings at Opening Ceremony of 2026 Winter Olympics & More Uplifting Moments in Latin Music This is why on Friday night (Feb. 6), all eyes were on the Opening Ceremony of Milano Cortina 2026, which took place across the various venues of this edition of the Games â€” Cortina d’Ampezzo, Predazzo and Livigno â€” but centered at Milanâ€™s San Siro Stadium, with a three-and-a-half-hour megashow created by Balich Wonder Studio, specialized in the creative direction of major events and with extensive expertise in Olympic cereâ€¦

items.title: How 'irresponsible' captain Romero's week ended in 'perfect storm'
items.summary: Thomas Frank admits Tottenham captain Cristian Romero's week ended in a "perfect storm" with a red card at Manchester United.

items.title: Laura Pausini Sings at Opening Ceremony of 2026 Winter Olympics & More Uplifting Moments in LatinÂ Music
items.summary: Plus, Fania legends and more to pay tribute to Johnny Pacheco in the Bronx, New York.
items.body: From career milestones to new music releases to major announcements and those little important moments,  Billboard  editors highlight  uplifting moments  in Latin music. Hereâ€™s what happened in the Latin music world this week. Laura Pausini Sings at Opening Ceremony of the Winter Olympics Grammy-winning artist Laura Pausini delivered a soul-stirring rendition of Italy’s national anthem, “Il Canto degli Italiani,” at the Opening Ceremony of the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics on Friday (Feb. 6). Backed by a choir dressed in Italy’s flag colors, Pausini â€” wearing an elegant black open-shoulder gown by Giorgio Armani â€” delivered an emotional performance that set the tone for the global event, celebrating Italyâ€™s rich history. The anthem was written by Goffredo Mameli in the 1800s, serving as a powerful reminder of Italy’s fight for unity and independence. Watch the moment below. https://www.instagram.com/p/DUbaSSPjADv/ Fania Legends to Celebrate Johnny Pacheco in New York City Lehman Center for the Performing Arts in The Bronx, New York, will host Tribute to Johnny Pacheco on Feb. 21, celebrating of the legendary flutist, composerâ€¦

items.title: Robyn Announces First Australian Tour in 14Â Years
items.summary: The tour marks Robynâ€™s first Australian performances since 2012, when she last visited the region during the Body Talk era.
items.body: Swedish pop icon Robyn will return to Australia in November 2026 for her first run of headline shows in the country in fourteen years. The tour marks Robynâ€™s first Australian performances since 2012, when she last visited the region during the Body Talk era, including an appearance at Parklife Festival. This time, the artist will play two arena shows: Sydneyâ€™s Qudos Bank Arena on Nov. 21 and Melbourneâ€™s Rod Laver Arena on Nov. 24. The Australian dates arrive as part of Robynâ€™s first major global tour since 2019 and coincide with the rollout of her forthcoming album Sexistential , due March 27. The record follows 2018â€™s Honey and represents her first full-length release in eight years. Robyn recently previewed the project with singles â€œTalk To Meâ€ and â€œSexistential,â€ following earlier track â€œDopamine.â€ In announcing the album last month, she described its emotional tone as a return inward after years of exploration. â€œItâ€™s like a spaceship coming through the atmosphere at a really high speed and crash landing,â€ she said in a statement. â€œThatâ€™s how I felt â€” like Iâ€™d been searching too far out into space, and now Iâ€™m crashing back into myself.â€ Known for pairing club-ready production â€¦

items.title: Ludwig GÃ¶ransson, â€˜Goldenâ€™ & More Win at 2026 Society of Composers & Lyricists Awards: FullÂ List
items.summary: Train Dreams composer Bryce Dessner won outstanding original score for an independent film.
items.body: Ludwig GÃ¶ransson won two competitive awards for his work on Sinners at the 2026 Society of Composers & Lyricists Awards, which were held on Friday (Feb. 6) at the Skirball Cultural Center in Los Angeles. The Swedish composer wonoutstanding original score for a studio film and outstanding original song for a dramatic or documentary visual media production for â€œI Lied to Youâ€ which he co-wrote with Raphael Saadiq . In addition, GÃ¶ransson and director Ryan Coogler received the Spirit of Collaboration Award, the SCLâ€™s most distinctive and meaningful award, which recognizes a composer/director partnership that has created a significant and enduring body of work. Since their first collaboration on Cooglerâ€™s  Fruitvale Station  (2013), GÃ¶ransson has scored all of Cooglerâ€™s feature films as a director â€”  Creed  (2015),  Black Panther  (2018),  Black Panther: Wakanda Forever  (2022), and  Sinners  (2025). GÃ¶ransson has received four of his five Oscar nominations for work on Coogler films. This year, he is Oscar-nominated for both best original score and best original song for â€œI Lied to You.â€ Related Ryan Coogler Recalls Going on the Miâ€¦

items.title: Bad Bunny Ahead of Super Bowl: â€˜Iâ€™m Just a Normal Guy That MakesÂ Musicâ€™
items.summary: Bad Bunny will headline the Apple Music Super Bowl LX Halftime Show on Sunday, Feb. 8, during Super Bowl LX.
items.body: Bad Bunny is focused less on spectacle and more on feeling as he prepares to headline the Apple Music Super Bowl LX Halftime Show . In a new interview with Access Hollywoodâ€™s Scott Evans , the global superstar, whose real name is Benito Antonio MartÃ­nez Ocasio, opened up about the mindset behind his highly anticipated halftime performance, reflecting on his journey from bagging groceries to one of the biggest stages in the world. â€œI just want to be there,â€ Bad Bunny said when asked how heâ€™s feeling in the final days before the show. â€œIâ€™m just ready to do it. I want to feel it. I want people to watch it and enjoy it.â€ Selecting the setlist for the halftime performance proved to be one of the biggest challenges. â€œThat was tough,â€ he admitted. â€œEven for my shows on tour, itâ€™s hard to pick 30 or 40 songs. So imagine for 30 minutes. It was very hard. The selection process was very intense.â€ Rather than focusing on hits alone, Bad Bunny said he approached the show as a storytelling exercise. â€œI had a vision about the story, the mood, and the feelings that I want to put on that show,â€ he explained. â€œI want people to feel happiness and joy. I want to make people dance. I want to make themâ€¦

items.title: Taiwanese Breakfast, Beef Noodle Soup, and Craft Beer: How I Eat My Way Around Taipei

It often makes you assume the food you were raised on is the best way to eat â€”â€¦

items.summary: Of all the travel recommendations out there, the most convincing ones read more like personal stories than notches on a checklist.
